feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Build Apps
feed.subtitle: SAP Build Apps Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Perform CRUD operation from SAP BTP BAS on Datasphere.
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We’re working on a BAS (CAPM) application and aiming to perform full CRUD operations using data from SAP Datasphere.

While we’ve successfully implemented the read (fetch) functionality using the architecture shown below, we’re currently facing challenges with enabling create, update, and delete operations directly on Datasphere tables.

 

 

We’d really appreciate any guidance, resources, or architectural suggestions that could help us achieve this. If anyone has experience or insights on enabling write operations with Datasphere from BAS, your support would be invaluable!

 

SAP Datasphere SAP Cloud Application Programming Model  SAP Fiori Cloud  

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Dynamic Handling of Credentials in SAP BPA
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I am trying to build an automation which accesses various S/4HANA Instances with different credentials depending who started it or which desktop agent started it. I dont want to ask the user to input their credentials. Is there a good way of handling credentials dynamically in SAP BPA?

entry.title: SAP Build - Mobile Preview not available
entry.content:
Dear community,

I wanted to create the SAP Build app following this learning documenthttps://developers.sap.com/tutorials/appgyver-create-application.html 

But however the configuration in our Build-Instance seems to be different (no trial - BTP instance plan type: build-default ). 

I don't have the possibility to preview the app on the mobile device. When choosing the objective all 3 mentioned options are there (plus Joule Skill). In the selection of the category everything looks identical to the learning ressource, but then I have only the following project types (see screenshot1). 

Following the tutorial there is then also no option to preview the app on the mobile device. 

So my question is: what might be the reason and how can I resolve this? 

 

Edit: I noticed, that there are more differences. So my assumption is, that this is related to the service type in the BTP ?

entry.title: How to Implement Text & Face Recognition Using Third-Party Services in SAP Build Apps?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working on an SAP Build Apps project where I need to implement text recognition (OCR) and face recognition features. Since SAP Build Apps does not have native OCR or face detection components, I want to integrate these features using third-party API services.

I need guidance on the following:

  1. Which third-party services (OCR + face recognition) work best with SAP Build Apps?

    • Examples: Google Vision API, AWS Rekognition, Azure Cognitive Services, etc.

  2. How to call these APIs from SAP Build Apps using:

    • HTTP Request (REST API)

    • Base64 image upload or file upload

    • Handling API keys securely

  3. Any sample app, guide, or best practice for implementing face detection or OCR in SAP Build Apps.

  4. How to handle image input (from camera or gallery) and send it to the external service for processing.

If anyone has done this before or has sample logic flow, screenshots, or API JSON examples, please share. It will help me a lot.

Thank you!
Please find attachment FYI,

entry.title: Unable to deploy Joule Skill in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content: Hi, I have setup Joule in our project. I am able to deploy the Joule Skill in SAP Build Process Automation. I have assigned all the roles ( including extensibility developer) to to my colleagues but they are not able to deploy Joule skill and also not able to launch it. They are getting an error saying 'Project cannot be deployed by the component 'Integration Gateway'. Project cannot be deployed in this environment because the user doesn't have the required "extensibility developer" role in Joule. Please contact your administrator to get the necessary permissions.

entry.title: SAP Build Apps: Use Dataelement-Texts for Labels
entry.content:
Hi,

I am using a RAP-OData-v4-UI-Service from our S/4 system as a base for my Build-Apps app, integrated by a destination on the subaccount. While the integration does provide all the entities and their fields and types it does not provide the labels, though they can be perfectly found in the metadata.

I can manually add a "$metadata"-entity of course, but I am not able to interpret the XML result in any way, so that was a dead end in my research.

Any idea how to solve that? I don't want to again translate all the things that SAP already has translated just because yet one SAP product is not able to compile another SAP product's output ...

Thanks in advance
André

PS: as a workaround, i can of course expose access to (a subset of) ddic-texts in my service, but that feels pretty nasty.

entry.title: Marketplace App UX Design Guidelines for SAP Users
entry.content:
I’m looking to gather insights from UX designers, SAP consultants, and developers who have experience designing marketplace applications integrated with SAP systems. My goal is to understand best practices for creating user-friendly, efficient, and intuitive interfaces for users who rely on SAP for enterprise resource planning (ERP) but also need to interact with external marketplaces.

Some areas I’m hoping to discuss include:

  • User workflows: How to design seamless navigation for SAP users who interact with marketplaces for purchasing, inventory management, or order tracking.
  • Data integration considerations: Best practices for displaying SAP data in a marketplace app without overwhelming users.
  • Consistency and usability: How to maintain consistency with SAP UI patterns while providing modern, marketplace-friendly interfaces.
  • Reducing cognitive load: Tips for simplifying complex processes such as procurement, bidding, or order approvals.
  • Mobile vs desktop experience: Recommendations for designing responsive or mobile-first experiences for SAP users.
  • Accessibility and compliance: UX considerations for enterprise users, including accessibility and security guidelines.
  • Tools and frameworks: Any preferred UX/UI frameworks or design systems that work well in SAP-integrated marketplace apps.

I’m looking for practical, real-world guidance—examples of dashboards, interfaces, or workflows that successfully balance SAP complexity with marketplace usability would be extremely helpful.

entry.title: Upload a file in SAP Build apps
entry.content:
Upload a file using SAP Build apps

Hello All,

Hope you are doing well.

I am creating a web application using SAP build apps in which I want to pick file from local filesystem and pass the content of the file to a LLM configured using AI core .

I tried using the Pick Files component available in market place for achieving the upload part and was able to do so but as mentioned in the official documentation the component does not support web platform.

 

Can you guide me how I can have this functionality for web application.

Thanks & regards,

Pankaj Gupta

entry.title: Hi! We want to use SAP Build Apps to create a full-stack application using ABAP (ADT-Eclipse).
entry.content:
Hi! Has anyone tried creating SAP Build + ABAP project using the free (shared) trial account?

I keep getting 401/403 error for the destination, when selecting it. (Both Create Project and Integration tab)

AI suggested that we need a "Communication Arrangement", which we cannot create, presumably due to not having the adequate permissions. Could somebody please confirm if you managed to do this on the trial account?

We'd greatly appreciate any tips or guidance.

entry.title: CSV Validation before uploading data to Data file load in SAP Marketing cloud
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We on a regular basis uploading contacts data using CSV into Data file load application and it consumes lot of time as we have to correct each and every error during validation step and again during upload we get new errors.

So, fixing all the errors and uploading data consumes lot of man hours and we want to validate the CSV file before uploading to SAP Marketing cloud and I want to get your ideas of validating this data using AI prompts or using any method which will reduce the time taken to correct errors multiple time during data file upload.

Can we achieve it using SAP Build Apps , joule with no code low code or do we have any better way to achieve this specifically for SAP Marketing cloud files.

Thanks for your inputs.

Regards,
Saravana

entry.title: How to apply a filter on a single property of a data set using more than one value of this property
entry.content:
Hi,
 
We need to filter a data entity using the filter conditions input of a "Get record collection" activity in Build Apps. For this, we use the following formula in the Formula Editor:
 
{type: "and", conditions: [{type: "eq", property: ["account.id"], value: appVars.collectedAccountTechnicalIds[0].accountTechnicalId}]}
 
appVars.collectedAccountTechnicalIds is the variable where we store the values needed to filter the data set. It is a list of objects with one property (accountTechnicalId).
 
The formula works well, but as you can see, we're filtering using the first occurrence of the array only ([0]), which results in showing the records filtered on this value only. We've made countless tests but they're always returning errors, for instance:
 
{type: "and", conditions: [{type: "eq", property: ["account.id"], value: appVars.collectedAccountTechnicalIds}]}
 
So the question is: using the Formula Editor, is there a simple way to apply the filter using all the values stored in the variable? Else, is there some sort of "for each" activity or should we create a loop or use a JS script in the logic canva? Basically, the goal here is to apply a filter on a single property of a data set using one or more values of this property.
 
Thanks a lot for your help on this, we're stuck on this problem for quite some time now and we need to implement this urgently for a demo to a client next Thursday...
 
Best regards,
 
LM.

entry.title: SAP Sales Cloud V2 Opportunity Update Extension Fields via SAP Build App
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working on SAP Sales Cloud and Service Cloud V2, 

I have requirement to update Extension fields based on Some Conidtion and use them in Validation and in Dynamic Rukes.

In SAP Service Cloud V2, I have added Extension Fields in Case and able to Update using SAP Build App Update Records without any Issues.

Same way I have Created Extension fields in SAP Sales Cloud V2 , I have added Extension fields in Opportunity and follow the below method to Update the Extension fields via SAP Build App.

Step 1 : Create Destination for Sales Cloud V2

Step 2: Use the Destination to Enable the Opportunity API in Integration Tab(In SAP Build App)

Step 3 : Create Data Variable and Select the newly added API and Choose Single Record and in Property select ID/Technical ID (Opportunity UUID pass via Page Parameters)

Step 3: Add Button in SAP Build App and In logic I have added Get Record Flow Function and select the Opportunity API, and bind the Id with Page Parameters(Passing into URL),

Working Scenario for Case Extension Field

In Flow Function JavaScript we have given Input from Get Record and Output as Object

After JavaScript Output I have use to Set Data Variable as below, Using that I can see the updated value in Extension fields availaile in Data Variable.

After that I have use Update Record and pass same Data Variable as Record and I can able to update the Case Extension fields in SAP Service Cloud V2.

Not Working Scenario for Case Extension Field

 

 

Same Method same steps but Opportunity API but getting error as below:

Error Message : Subnodes must not be present in Opportunity header patch payload

If anyone have any idea how to update the Extension fields in Opportunity via Build App Please help.

Rwegards,

Meet

@SAPbuild @sapbuild_user

entry.title: Cannot convert file to Base64 in SAP Build Apps – CSP error with blob URL
entry.content:
After uploading a file using "Pick files" in Build Apps,
we try to encode the file to Base64 using "Convert file to base64" and pass it to the next process.

However, when executed, the following error appears in the browser’s developer console, and the process fails.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Connecting to 'blob:https://dev-preview.us10.apps.build.cloud.sap/e398f733-xxxxxxxx' violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "connect-src ". Note that '' matches only URLs with network schemes ('http', 'https', 'ws', 'wss'), or URLs whose scheme matches `self`'s scheme. The scheme 'blob:' must be added explicitly. The action has been blocked.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Fetch API cannot load blob:https://dev-preview.us10.apps.build.cloud.sap/e398f733-xxxxxxxx. Refused to connect because it violates the document's Content Security Policy.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

This worked correctly in the past (around June 2025).

Thanks in advance for your help and suggestions.

entry.title: Android AAB build fails at 92%
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm trying to deploy my simple guide app as an Android AAB in SAP Build Apps (community edition). The build gets to 92% then fails with this error:

jarsigner error: java.lang.RuntimeException: keystore load: toDerInputStream rejects tag type 80

Full log snippet:

AB version: 3.49.0
COMMAND: 

USER_METERING_ENABLED=true SHOW_SUBSCRIPTION_VERIFICATION_NOTIFICATION=false SUBSCRIPTION_VERIFICATION_NOTIFICATION_DISMISSIBLE=true NODE_OPTIONS=--max-old-space-size=2000 --no-experimental-global-navigator  npxrnv repackage-android -p android -s standalone_bundle -c standalone --ci --yes --packageManager yarn --offline --templates-path /orchestra-cache/4.18.24/ejected_templates --aapt2-path /app/aapt2/aapt2 

FAILED with ERROR: 

warn: You have integration @sba-runtime/integration-builder defined, but it wasn't found in package.json. ERR: Error: Cannot find module '../renative.json'
Require stack:
- ./node_modules/@sba-runtime/integration-builder/lib/config.js
- ./node_modules/@sba-runtime/integration-builder/lib/tasks/taskExport.js
- ./node_modules/@sba-runtime/integration-builder/lib/index.js
- ./node_modules/@rnv/core/lib/modules/index.js
Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/app/.appgyver/app/renative.private.json'
 at Object.openSync (node:fs:561:18)
 at Object.readFileSync (node:fs:445:35)
 at handleCryptoApiKeys (/app/current/buildHooks/dist/index.js:29383:56)
 at /app/current/node_modules/@rnv/core/src/buildHooks/index.ts:21:50 {
 errno: -2,
error: ⨯ ○ repackage-android: COMMAND: 
jarsigner -keystore /app/current/keystore/keystore.jks -storepass ********* /tmp/repackager-xRltsa/app-release.aab ********* 
FAILED with ERROR: 
jarsigner error: java.lang.RuntimeException: keystore load: toDerInputStream rejects tag type 80
Error: Command failed with exit code 1: jarsigner -keystore /app/current/keystore/keystore.jks -storepass ********* /tmp/repackager-xRltsa/app-release.aab *********
jarsigner error: java.lang.RuntimeException: keystore load: toDerInputStream rejects tag type 80
 at makeError (/app/current/node_modules/execa/lib/error.js:60:11)
 at handlePromise (/app/current/node_modules/execa/index.js:118:26)
 at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:105:5)
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│ ⨯ SUMMARY | 12/18/2025, 11:11:24 PM | rnv@1.3.0-feat-old-overrides.0
│ $ npx rnv repackage-android -p android -s standalone_bundle -c standalone --ci --yes --packageManager yarn --offline --templates-path /orchestra-cache/4.18.24/ejected_templates --aapt2-path /app/aapt2/aapt2
│ warn: You have integration @sba-runtime/integration-builder defined, but it wasn't found in package.json. ERR: Error: Cannot find module '../renative.json'
Require stack:
- ./node_modules/@sba-runtime/integration-builder/lib/config.js
- ./node_modules/@sba-runtime/integration-builder/lib/tasks/taskExport.js
- ./node_modules/@sba-runtime/integration-builder/lib/index.js
- ./node_modules/@rnv/core/lib/modules/index.js
│ error: ⨯ ○ repackage-android: COMMAND: 
jarsigner -keystore /app/current/keystore/keystore.jks -storepass ********* /tmp/repackager-xRltsa/app-release.aab ********* 
FAILED with ERROR: 
jarsigner error: java.lang.RuntimeException: keystore load: toDerInputStream rejects tag type 80
Error: Command failed with exit code 1: jarsigner -keystore /app/current/keystore/keystore.jks -storepass ********* /tmp/repackager-xRltsa/app-release.aab *********
jarsigner error: java.lang.RuntimeException: keystore load: toDerInputStream rejects tag type 80
 at makeError (/app/current/node_modules/execa/lib/error.js:60:11)
 at handlePromise (/app/current/node_modules/execa/index.js:118:26)
 at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:105:5)
│ Project location: ./platformBuilds/standalone_android │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

What I've tried:

  • Created fresh keystore with KeyStore Explorer (JKS, RSA 2048, SHA-256 with RSA).
  • Uploaded .jks file, correct passwords, alias.
  • Cleared browser cache, incognito mode, different browsers.
  • Started blank projects – same error.
  • Image assets and configuration seem fine.

Is this a known server-side bug? Any workaround for community edition users?

Screenshots attached: keystore creation, deployment config, full error.

Thanks for any help – I'm a beginner and this is the last step for my app!

I have been totally dependent on Grok to build this and I cant get over this last hurdle, can anyone please help?

Jayne

entry.title: Issues Migrating from DEV to QAS Using CTMS with SAP Build Apps and SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
When using SAP Build Apps and SAP Build Process Automation,
I encountered issues migrating from the DEV environment to the QAS environment via CTMS.
It seems the problem is related to the scheme version, as the release process fails.

As a workaround, I tried changing the scheme version before releasing, but I couldn’t find a successful method.
In SAP Build Process Automation, I even had to remove all dependencies to import the package, which is not ideal.

Is there any effective way to handle this migration without removing all dependencies or facing scheme version conflicts?
Any best practices or recommendations would be greatly appreciated.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SAP Build AppsやSAP Build Process Automationを使用して、CTMSでDEV環境からQAS環境へ移送しようとした際、
scheme versionの影響と思われる問題でリリースがうまくできませんでした。

対策としてscheme versionを変更してリリースを試みましたが、成功する方法が見つかりませんでした。
特にSAP Build Process Automationでは、パッケージをインポートするために依存関係をすべて削除する必要があり、
非常に非効率的です。

依存関係を削除せず、scheme versionの問題を回避して移送する良い方法やベストプラクティスはありますでしょうか？
アドバイスをいただけると幸いです。

entry.title: systemVars.dimensions.viewport.height malfunction
entry.content:
In deployment runtime version 4.18.23 of SAP Build Apps free/Appgyver, systemVars.dimensions.viewport.height isn't working causing keyboard to cover the input field along with half the app screen upon trying to write, as shown in the first 2 screenshots!

The last screenshot shows the proper systemVars.dimensions.viewport.height function using older runtime version 4.15.15!
